content:
TITLE: Running Text Analysis on Hotel Review Sample 1
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands to navigate to the ai-900 directory and run the analyze-text.ps1 script on the first hotel review sample.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/04-module-04.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
cd ai-900
./analyze-text.ps1 review1.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sentiment-Based Filtering in Azure Cognitive Search
DESCRIPTION: Query to filter search results by sentiment, specifically searching for reviews with negative sentiment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/05-create-cognitive-search-solution.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
search=sentiment:'negative'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Language Understanding Model Credentials in PowerShell Script

SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/04c-conversational-language-understanding.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
$endpointUrl="https://some-name.cognitiveservices.azure.com/language/..."
$key = "0ab1c23de4f56gh7i8901234jkl567m8"
$projectName = "name"
$deploymentName = "name"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python List Creation Example in Bing Copilot
DESCRIPTION: An example of Python code that would be generated when asking Bing Copilot to create a list in Python. This represents what users would see when using the code generation capability.

TITLE: Python Script for Processing Model Output in Azure ML Designer
DESCRIPTION: Python script used in the Execute Python Script module to filter and rename the output columns from the Score Model module. It selects only the prediction labels and probabilities, renaming them to more user-friendly names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02b-create-classification-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import pandas as pd

def azureml_main(dataframe1 = None, dataframe2 = None):

    scored_results = dataframe1[['Scored Labels', 'Scored Probabilities']]
    scored_results.rename(columns={'Scored Labels':'DiabetesPrediction',
                                'Scored Probabilities':'Probability'},
                        inplace=True)
    return scored_results
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Processing Model Output in Python for Auto Price Prediction
DESCRIPTION: This Python script is used in an Execute Python Script module to process the output of the score model. It selects only the 'Scored Labels' column from the input dataframe and renames it to 'predicted_price'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02a-create-regression-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pandas as pd

def azureml_main(dataframe1 = None, dataframe2 = None):

    scored_results = dataframe1[['Scored Labels']]
    scored_results.rename(columns={'Scored Labels':'predicted_price'},
                    inplace=True)
    return scored_results
```

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: powershell

```

./ocr.ps1 advert.jpg
```

TITLE: Basic Search Query in Azure Cognitive Search
DESCRIPTION: Basic search query to return all documents in the index with a count. Uses the search=* parameter with $count=true to get total number of documents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/05-create-cognitive-search-solution.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
search=*&$count=true
```

TITLE: Configuring Data Pipeline Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Configuration parameters for data cleaning and normalization in Azure ML Designer pipeline. Includes settings for handling missing values and normalizing numeric columns using MinMax scaling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02a-create-regression-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
Clean Missing Data:
  minimum_missing_value_ratio: 0.0
  maximum_missing_value_ratio: 1.0
  cleaning_mode: "Remove entire row"

Normalize Data:
  transformation_method: "MinMax"
  columns:
    - symboling
    - wheel-base
    - length
    - width
    - height
    - curb-weight
    - engine-size
    - bore
    - stroke
    - compression-ratio
    - horsepower
    - peak-rpm
    - city-mpg
    - highway-mpg
```

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```

./analyze-image.ps1 store-camera-1.jpg
```

TITLE: Testing Diabetes Prediction Model with Sample JSON Input
DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON payload for testing the diabetes prediction endpoint. Contains patient data including measurements like plasma glucose, blood pressure, BMI, and other relevant health metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02b-create-classification-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "Inputs": {
    "input1":
      [
        { "PatientID": 1882185,
          "Pregnancies": 9,
          "PlasmaGlucose": 104,
          "DiastolicBloodPressure": 51,
          "TricepsThickness": 7,
          "SerumInsulin": 24,
          "BMI": 27.36983156,
          "DiabetesPedigree": 1.3504720469999998,
          "Age": 43 }
        ]
      },
  "GlobalParameters":  {}
}
```

TITLE: Preparing CSV Data for Auto Price Prediction in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines CSV data containing feature values for three cars, used as input for the auto price prediction model. It includes various attributes of the cars but excludes the price, which is to be predicted.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02a-create-regression-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csv
CODE:
```
symboling,normalized-losses,make,fuel-type,aspiration,num-of-doors,body-style,drive-wheels,engine-location,wheel-base,length,width,height,curb-weight,engine-type,num-of-cylinders,engine-size,fuel-system,bore,stroke,compression-ratio,horsepower,peak-rpm,city-mpg,highway-mpg
3,NaN,alfa-romero,gas,std,two,convertible,rwd,front,88.6,168.8,64.1,48.8,2548,dohc,four,130,mpfi,3.47,2.68,9,111,5000,21,27
3,NaN,alfa-romero,gas,std,two,convertible,rwd,front,88.6,168.8,64.1,48.8,2548,dohc,four,130,mpfi,3.47,2.68,9,111,5000,21,27
1,NaN,alfa-romero,gas,std,two,hatchback,rwd,front,94.5,171.2,65.5,52.4,2823,ohcv,six,152,mpfi,2.68,3.47,9,154,5000,19,26
```

TITLE: Testing a Regression Model with JSON Input Data in Azure ML
DESCRIPTION: JSON test data for an automobile price prediction model. The data includes various automobile features like make, fuel type, and technical specifications that serve as inputs for the prediction endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02a-create-regression-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "Inputs": {
                "WebServiceInput0":
                [
                    {
                        "symboling": 3,
                        "normalized-losses": 1.0,
                        "make": "alfa-romero",
                        "fuel-type": "gas",
                        "aspiration": "std",
                        "num-of-doors": "two",
                        "body-style": "convertible",
                        "drive-wheels": "rwd",
                        "engine-location": "front",
                        "wheel-base": 88.6,
                        "length": 168.8,
                        "width": 64.1,
                        "height": 48.8,
                        "curb-weight": 2548,
                        "engine-type": "dohc",
                        "num-of-cylinders": "four",
                        "engine-size": 130,
                        "fuel-system": "mpfi",
                        "bore": 3.47,
                        "stroke": 2.68,
                        "compression-ratio": 9,
                        "horsepower": 111,
                        "peak-rpm": 5000,
                        "city-mpg": 21,
                        "highway-mpg": 27
                    }
                ]
            },
    "GlobalParameters": {}
    }
```

TITLE: Split Data Configuration for Model Training
DESCRIPTION: Parameters for splitting the dataset into training and validation sets using the Split Data module in Azure ML Designer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02a-create-regression-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
Split Data:
  splitting_mode: "Split Rows"
  fraction_of_rows_in_first_output: 0.7
  randomized_split: true
  random_seed: 123
  stratified_split: false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Columns for Data Normalization in Azure ML Designer
DESCRIPTION: A list of column names to be normalized using the MinMax transformation method in the Normalize Data module. These numeric columns are being scaled to a common range to prevent features with larger values from dominating model training.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02b-create-classification-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Pregnancies, PlasmaGlucose, DiastolicBloodPressure, TricepsThickness, SerumInsulin, BMI, DiabetesPedigree, Age
```

TITLE: Testing a Deployed Regression Model with JSON Input in Azure ML
DESCRIPTION: JSON input data for testing a deployed bike rental prediction model. The sample includes various features like date attributes, weather conditions, and temperature values that the model uses to predict the expected number of bike rentals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02-module-02.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "Inputs": { 
    "data": [
      {
        "day": 1,
        "mnth": 1,   
        "year": 2022,
        "season": 2,
        "holiday": 0,
        "weekday": 1,
        "workingday": 1,
        "weathersit": 2, 
        "temp": 0.3, 
        "atemp": 0.3,
        "hum": 0.3,
        "windspeed": 0.3 
      }
    ]    
  },   
  "GlobalParameters": 1.0
}
```

TITLE: Testing JSON Input for Penguin Clustering Prediction in Azure ML
DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload defines the input data for testing a deployed clustering model. It includes penguin measurements (CulmenLength, CulmenDepth, FlipperLength, and BodyMass) to predict which cluster the penguin belongs to.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/instructions/02c-create-clustering-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "Inputs": {
        "input1": [
            {
                "CulmenLength": 49.1,
                "CulmenDepth": 4.8,
                "FlipperLength": 1220,
                "BodyMass": 5150
            }
        ]
    },
    "GlobalParameters":  {}
}
```

TITLE: Liquid Template for Exercise List Generation
DESCRIPTION: Liquid templating code that filters pages containing 'instructions' in URL and generates a markdown table listing exercise titles with links.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: liquid
CODE:
```
{% assign labs = site.pages | where_exp:"page", "page.url contains '/instructions'" %}
| Exercises |
| ------- | 
{% for activity in labs  %}| [{{ activity.lab.title }}]({{ site.github.url }}{{ activity.url }}) |
{% endfor %}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Markdown Table for AI-900 Lab Mapping
DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet creates a table mapping AI-900 trainer lab numbers to their corresponding topics and instruction links. It covers four modules, each with a specific focus area in AI fundamentals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftlearning/ai-900-aifundamentals/blob/main/mapping.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| AI-900 Trainer Lab # | Topic | Instructions |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 01: AI-900 Module 01 | Explore Cognitive Services | [01-Lab-Instructions](https://aka.ms/ai900-module-01) |
| 02: AI-900 Module 02 | Explore Automated Machine Learning | [02-Lab-Instructions](https://aka.ms/ai900-module-02) |
| 03: AI-900 Module 03 | Analyze Images with Computer Vision  | [03-Lab-Instructions](https://aka.ms/ai900-module-03) |
| 04: AI-900 Module 04 | Analyze Text with the Language Service | [04-Lab-Instructions](https://aka.ms/ai900-module-04) |
```
